skill.name: giil
skill.description: Get Image [from] Internet Link - Zero-setup CLI for downloading full-resolution images from iCloud, Dropbox, Google Photos, and Google Drive share links. Four-tier capture strategy, browser automation, HEIC conversion, album support. Node.js/Playwright.
skill.summary: Get Image [from] Internet Link - Zero-setup CLI for downloading full-resolution images from iCloud, ...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation for the giil CLI tool. No executable code is present in the skill directory. The actual tool installation uses curl-pipe-to-bash which carries inherent risks that users should be aware of.

content.user_title: Download Images from Cloud Share Links
content.value_statement: Stop struggling to get screenshots to your remote AI sessions. giil downloads full-resolution images from iCloud, Dropbox, Google Photos, and Drive share links with one command.
actual_capabilities: Downloads images from iCloud share links using browser automation
Extracts full-resolution images from Google Photos and Drive
Converts HEIC/HEIF images to standard formats automatically
Downloads entire photo albums with indexed filenames
Provides JSON output for AI tool integration
Uses four-tier capture strategy for maximum reliability
limitations: Requires internet connection to cloud services
Some links require public sharing enabled
Linux users need to install HEIC conversion libraries manually

use_cases.title: Debug UI issues remotely
use_cases.description: SSH into servers and download iPhone screenshots directly to your remote AI coding session

use_cases.title: Share visual context instantly
use_cases.description: Paste cloud photo links to Claude Code for immediate visual analysis without file transfers

use_cases.title: Batch download photo albums
use_cases.description: Download entire shared albums from family events or work projects with organized filenames

prompt_templates.title: Basic image download
prompt_templates.prompt: Use giil to download this image: https://share.icloud.com/photos/xxx

prompt_templates.title: JSON output mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Download this image with JSON metadata: giil "URL" --json

prompt_templates.title: Album download
prompt_templates.prompt: Download all photos from this album to ~/Downloads: giil "URL" --all --output ~/Downloads

prompt_templates.title: Debug mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug why this image won't download: giil "URL" --debug --verbose

best_practices: Use --json flag for reliable parsing in scripts and AI workflows
Enable --debug mode when troubleshooting failed downloads
Install HEIC support on Linux before processing Apple photos
anti_patterns: Don't use giil for private links without public sharing enabled
Avoid downloading copyrighted content you don't have rights to
Don't rely on viewport screenshots for quality-critical work

faq.question: Is giil compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, giil outputs JSON that Claude Code can parse for image analysis workflows.

faq.question: What are the download limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits, but cloud services may rate-limit bulk downloads. Use polite delays.

faq.question: Can I integrate giil with my scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, use --json flag for structured output and --output to specify directories.

faq.question: Is my data safe with giil?
faq.answer: Processing happens locally. No data is sent anywhere except to cloud services you specify.

faq.question: Why am I getting 'Auth required' errors?
faq.answer: The link isn't publicly shared. Ask the owner to enable public access in their cloud settings.

faq.question: How does giil compare to wget or curl?
faq.answer: giil handles JavaScript-heavy cloud services that wget/curl cannot, with automatic quality optimization.
